title: "SyntaxError: invalid syntax" while trying to remove an environment

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
I'm just learning how environments work, so I may have done something silly.

That said, I did this:

```
spack env create moose
spack env activate moose
despacktivate
spack env activate --without-view moose
spack add emacs python@2.7.16 python@3.7.6
spack concretize
spack install
spack env ls
spack env rm moose
```

and this is what happened when I ran that `env rm`:

```
$ spack env rm moose
  File "<string>", line 1
    from distutils.sysconfig import get_config_h_filename; print get_config_h_filename()
                                                                                     ^
SyntaxError: invalid syntax
==> Really remove environment moose? [y/N] y
==> Error: Environment moose can't be removed while activated.
$ despacktivate
  File "<string>", line 1
    from distutils.sysconfig import get_config_h_filename; print get_config_h_filename()
                                                                                     ^
SyntaxError: invalid syntax
  File "<string>", line 1
    from distutils.sysconfig import get_config_h_filename; print get_config_h_filename()
                                                                                     ^
SyntaxError: invalid syntax
$
````
